issues.title: Missing IRS Taxable Income Treatment Requirements
issues.description: While the regulation mentions CFR requirements for personal use reimbursement, it lacks comprehensive treatment of when cellular phone benefits constitute taxable income under IRS regulations. The policy must address that allowances exceeding the business use portion are taxable income to employees, and establish procedures for proper tax reporting.

legal_citations.text: The value of employer-provided cell phone service is excludable from an employee's gross income as a working condition fringe benefit only to the extent the service is provided primarily for noncompensatory business purposes. Any personal use must be treated as taxable income unless it is de minimis.

issues.required_language: The district shall treat cellular phone allowances and reimbursements in accordance with IRS regulations. Allowances that exceed documented business use shall be reported as taxable income to the employee. The district shall establish procedures to ensure proper tax reporting and withholding for any personal use benefits that are not de minimis incidental personal use.

issues.title: Missing Public Records Act Compliance for Communication Records
issues.description: The policy lacks provisions addressing that communications conducted on district-provided or reimbursed devices may be subject to California Public Records Act requirements. This is critical for legal compliance and transparency obligations.

legal_citations.text: Public records include any writing containing information relating to the conduct of the public's business prepared, owned, used, or retained by any state or local agency regardless of physical form or characteristics.

issues.required_language: Employees shall be notified that communications conducted on district-provided devices or devices for which reimbursement is provided may constitute public records subject to disclosure under the California Public Records Act. The district shall establish procedures for retention and potential disclosure of such communications in accordance with legal requirements.

issues.title: Inadequate Approval and Authorization Procedures
issues.description: While the regulation mentions the Superintendent will determine employee needs, it lacks specific approval procedures, authorization levels, and criteria for different types of allowances or reimbursements. This creates potential for inconsistent application and fiscal control issues.

legal_citations.text: The governing board shall establish policies for the management of district funds and may delegate implementation to the superintendent, but must maintain appropriate oversight and control procedures.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall establish written procedures requiring prior written approval for all cellular phone allowances and reimbursements. Procedures shall specify authorization levels, maximum allowable amounts, required documentation, and periodic review requirements. All approvals shall be documented and maintained for audit purposes.

issues.title: Missing Board Approval Requirement for Policy Changes
issues.description: The policy should specify that significant changes to cellular phone reimbursement procedures or allowance amounts require Board approval, particularly for administrative positions.

legal_citations.text: The governing board may delegate to employees the authority to act on behalf of the district, but retains ultimate authority over district policies and significant expenditure decisions.

issues.required_language: Significant changes to cellular phone reimbursement rates, allowance amounts, or eligibility criteria shall require Board approval. The Superintendent shall report annually to the Board on cellular phone expenditures and usage.
